strings.Value: "I see you've heard of me. But alas, I don't believe I've had the pleasure of meeting you."
"And every word of it, the honest truth! The Varnling Host are the best swords for sale this side of the Inner Sea – and I am first among them!"
"People say many things. I prefer actions to words."
[Bow] "You are too kind, Your Highness!"
"What do you think of today's reception?"
"What are your thoughts on the future of Varnhold?"
"I have to go."
"Do you mean spies and traitors? I'm sorry to disappoint you, but there's no one like that among us."
"If that is my commander's decision, I can only support it."
"I suppose such people could be found... But it depends on the sort of diplomacy you have in mind."

{n}Natala {g|House Surtova}Surtova{/g} gives you a cool but mildly curious look, as if you were a peculiar animal at a zoo.{/n} "{Name}, right hand of {d|Varn}Maegar Varn{/d}, hero of the legendary {g|Varnling Host}Varnling Host{/g}. They say your courage is only matched by your ingenuity. Is this true?"
"How do you like the celebration? In your expeditions and battles you've hardly had the chance to enjoy luxury... Or at least what stands for luxury in these lands."
"I see you are cautious. A commendable quality for people of your line of work."
"Bold words! But you've proven you are capable of putting them into action."
{n}There is still a smile on Natala's face, but her eyes and voice become colder than Issian ice.{/n} "An oversight. People in your trade are wise to know their potential employers... Or enemies."

"Do you know why I haven't? Because it would have been a terribly obvious and crude response to {g|Restov}Restov's{/g} maneuverings. On the battlefield, you wouldn't seek to do the very thing that your adversary expects, and has been preparing for, would you? But I assure you, sooner or later we will make our move... Just not today."
"I see you are not only daring but well-mannered. A rare combination of virtues, especially among people in your trade!"

"You are addressing the ruler of Brevoy. I don't guess anyone's future, I determine it. But as for Varnhold... Truth be told, I am still thinking about what to do with you. We'll see how you deal with the lands you've received."
"Have a safe journey! I wish your barony happiness and prosperity!'

"Your commander is certainly courageous, but doesn't think clearly about certain matters. He's bluntly refused to take envoys with him – as if he thinks his young barony can survive without allies! Do you think there are reasonable people in this new baron's circle, who understand how important diplomacy is for the state?"
"I see you are a perfect match for your leader. Well, I can only pray that Varnhold thrives in isolation from the outside world."
"Loyalty is commendable. But still sometimes it can be useful to look around and see where your lord is leading you. Is it over a cliff?"

"A wise commander surrounds himself with people whose strengths compensate for his own weaknesses. It's a pleasure to see at least some of {d|Varn}Varn's{/d} people can boast the foresight that he so sorely lacks."

"But in any case, for now this is just empty rhetoric. Your young state must first prove that it is worthy of diplomacy. I suspect we shall revisit this conversation in a year or two. – If, by that time, the name of Varnhold can still be found on the maps."

"I suppose Lady Aldori and Lord Mayor Sellemius are very happy with this affair they've managed to plot behind my back, along with their new toy baronies. Honestly, I should remind them who rules Brevoy, and call an immediate end to the entire farce."
